components.description:
A knife with a long steel blade, as a chef uses to slice meat or vegetables. Depicted with a black or brown handle and positioned at a 45° angle, often with its point at the lower right.

May be used for content concerning cooking and food preparation, but often represents various senses of cutting and stabbing. Its Unicode name, Hocho, means “kitchen knife” in Japanese and refers to a variety of knives used in Japan.

Not to be confused with üó°Ô∏è Dagger or ‚öîÔ∏è Crossed Swords.
components.title: Hocho

May be used for content concerning cooking and food preparation, but often represents various senses of cutting and stabbing. Its Unicode name, Hocho, means “kitchen knife” in Japanese and refers to a variety of knives used in Japan.

Not to be confused with üó°Ô∏è Dagger or ‚öîÔ∏è Crossed Swords.
title: Hocho

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Tool symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A versatile type of knife¬†commonly found¬†in kitchens in Japan. Generally used for cutting and¬†filleting meat and fish. Not to be confused wi http://emojipedia.org/hocho/
emoji_net_data.name: kitchen knife

bn:00049099n: The act of terminating a life

bn:00005704n: An instrument of attack or defense in combat, as a gun, missile, or sword.
Any instrument or instrumentality used in fighting or hunting
An instrument of attack or defense in combat or hunting, e.g. most guns, missiles, or swords.
Instrument used to inflict damage or harm to living beings, structures, or systems
A weapon, arm, or armament is any device used in order to inflict damage or harm to living beings, structures, or systems.
Weapon, arm, or armament are terms for any device used to inflict damage or harm to living beings, structures, or systems.

bn:00049322n: Edge tool used as a cutting instrument; has a pointed blade with a sharp edge and a handle
Any blade-like part in a tool or a machine designed for cutting, such as the knives for a chipper.
Utensil or tool designed for cutting.

A utensil consisting of a sharpened piece of hard material such as steel or other metal, ceramic, glass or stone, usually attached to a handle, that is formed in a manner that allows for cutting softer materials, especially meat or other food.
A knife is a cutting tool with a cutting edge or blade, hand-held or otherwise, with or without a handle.

bn:03308821n: There are a number of different types of Japanese kitchen knives.

bn:00011081n: A cutting or thrusting weapon that has a long metal blade and a hilt with a hand guard
A sword is a blade weapon used primarily and original have two hands for cutting or thrusting.
A long-bladed weapon having a handle and sometimes a hilt and designed to stab, hew, or slice.
A sword is an edged weapon used primarily for cutting or thrusting.
A long-bladed weapon that has a handle (and sometimes a hilt) and is designed to stab, cut or slash.

bn:00075834n: Plates, dishes and other eating and serving tableware, usually made of some ceramic material.
Tableware is the dishes or dishware used for setting a table, serving food and dining.
The eating and serving utensils such as knives, forks and spoons.
Articles for use at the table (dishes and silverware and glassware)
Plates used for setting a table and serving food
Crockery used for serving or cooking food
The cutlery, crockery and glassware used in setting a table for a meal.

bn:00022412n: The act of preparing a meal.
The act of preparing something (as food) by the application of heat
Cooking or cookery is the art of preparing food for consumption with the use of heat.
The art and practice of preparing food for consumption, especially by the application of heat; cooking.
Cooking is the process of preparing food by use of heat, or through chemical reactions without the presence of heat.
Art of preparing food for consumption with the use of heat
The process of preparing food by using heat.

bn:00060651n: Used for the processing of food and are often used in the kitchen
Any knife used for preparing food
A kitchen knife is any knife that is intended to be used in food preparation.
A small sharp knife used in paring fruits or vegetables

bn:00049248n: A room equipped for preparing meals
Space, which is primarily used for preparation and in part to the storage of food
A room or area for preparing food.
A kitchen is a room or part of a room used for cooking and food preparation.
A room equipped for preparing and cooking food.

bn:00075818n: A knife used for eating at dining table
A table knife is an item of cutlery with a single cutting edge, and a blunt end-part of a table setting.
